title: A spate of cash box thefts on Wellington buses - 26-Apr-2024 - NZ Law and Order news
text: News | Law and Order 26 Apr 2024 9:33 | outlook hotmail | yahoo mail | gmail | news | weather | finance | shopping | about nzcity | Search | NZCity News SEARCH Google Bing NZ News NewsLinks the White Pages NZ Street Names the Yellow Pages Yahoo NZ Web sites SearchNZ NZ Domain Names CUSTOMISE Start Page Personalise News Top Stories Business Sports Politics Health & Safety Law and Order Technology Education Living & Travel Entertainment Motoring Environment National International Accidents Maori Rural Local Politics Sport Weather Finance Shopping Jobs Horoscopes Lotto Results Photo Gallery Site Gallery TVNow Dating SearchNZ NZSearch Crime.co.nz RugbyLeague Make Home About NZCity Contact NZCity Your Privacy Advertising Login Join for Free Home > News > Law and Order A spate of cash box thefts on Wellington buses A spate of cash box thefts on Wellington buses 26 April 2024 Police are investigating four reports of robberies targeting bus drivers last week, and say they all appear to be linked. Each time, two young people wearing hoodies have got on a bus on Petone's High Street, and stolen the till. Police say they've found two of the four stolen boxes, and investigations are ongoing. No drivers have been injured, but several have been offered support. >> More Law and Order News © 2024 Newstalk ZB, NZCity Other Law and Order News 26 Apr: A 61-year-old Porirua man's been arrested, after a car tyre slashing spree 25 Apr: A late night appeal has been filed over the High Court's ruling, the Children's Minister wouldn't need to front up to the Waitangi Tribunal 25 Apr: A man is facing multiple charges in Whakatane court today, after allegedly taking three people hostage and firing at Police last night 25 Apr: Children's Minister Karen Chhour won't need to front the Waitangi Tribunal 24 Apr: Police are appealing for information on an Auckland 15-year-old - who's been missing all year 24 Apr: A 46-year-old man has been arrested in relation to an alleged homicide in Hawera on Monday 24 Apr: Otago University students are being urged to secure properties from thieves Top Stories RUGBY The Miami Heat's caused a boilover in the first round of the NBA playoffs...beating the top ranked Celtics 111 to 101 in Boston to level their Eastern Conference series one-all More... BUSINESS The cruise-ship season success is being celebrated -- but there's concern next season could hit an iceberg More...
